text: Henry S. Hale Henry S. Hale was a Philadelphia inventor and industrialist. He was co-owner of the Hale & Kilburn company of Philadelphia along with Cheney Kilburn. The Hale & Kilburn company's primary business was the production of railroad car seats for the expanding American railroad companies. The Hale & Kilburn company was sold to J.P. Morgan & Co. in 1911 for $9 million.Edward G. Budd Mfg. Co ==References== Category:American railway entrepreneurs Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing Category:Businesspeople from Philadelphia Category:19th-century American businesspeople
title: Henry S. Hale
